title: Jimmy Neesham mocks ICC after scrapping Super Over rule which saw New Zealand lose to England in CWC
text:
New Zealand cricketer Jimmy Neesham has poked fun at the ICC's latest ruling which will prevent a repeat of England's Super Over heroics.

The ICC announced on Monday that should a Super Over be tied - as was the case when England beat New Zealand in the World Cup final in July - it would be replayed and countback wouldn't be relied on.

Had the rule been in place when England took on New Zealand at Lord's, the Super Over would have been replayed.

Jimmy Neesham (left) has poked fun at the ICC's latest ruling scrapping the use of countbacks

Ben Stokes lifts the World Cup trophy above his head after England's win at Lord's in July

NEW RULING In the event a Super Over is tied, no longer with countback be relied on and the Super Over be replayed until there is a winner.

After New Zealand and England both scored 15 in the Super Over after the game ended in a tie, but England won having scored boundaries in the match.

Cricket's world governing body have announced the new ruling will come into effect in the semi-finals and finals of all ICC events.

The news prompted New Zealand bowler Neesham to tweet: 'Next on the agenda: Better binoculars for the ice spotters on the Titanic.'

A number of Neesham's followers on social media shared his frustration.

'Exactly. Damage was already done,' wrote one. Others took delight in Neesham airing his thoughts publicly.

'Great to see you’re completely over this now Jimmy, those scars are all but invisible,' one added.
description: New Zealand cricketer Jimmy Neesham has poked fun at the ICC's latest ruling which will prevent a repeat of England's Super Over heroics.
